tit.e: Saisekki (microlith; a small chipped stone tools characterized by a cutting edge)
Saisekki (microlith; a small chipped stone tools characterized by a cutting edge)

sen.j: 細石器(さいせっき、マイクロリス、microlith)とは、打製石器の一種で、小型かつ刃の特徴を持つ石器である。
sen.e: "Saisekki" (microlith) is a kind of chipped stone tools, which is small and is characterized by a cutting edge.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Saisekki (microlith) is a kind of chipped stone tools, which is small and is characterized by a cutting edge.
Saisekki (microlith) is a kind of chipped stone tools, which is small and is characterized by a cutting edge.

sen.j: 日本国内では一般的には旧石器時代後期に分類される。
sen.e: In Japan, it is generally classified as belonging to the latter part of the Paleolithic era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In Japan, it is generally classified as belonging to the late Paleolithic period.
In Japan, it is generally classified as belonging to the late Paleolithic period.

sen.j: しかし、ヨーロッパ等では旧石器時代および新石器時代の過渡期として中石器時代が設定されている。
sen.e: However, in Europe and other parts of the world, there is a transition period called the Mesolithic era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, in Europe and other parts of the world, a transition from the Paleolithic period to the Neolithic period is set as the Mesolithic period.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「旧石器時代および新石器時代の」を補足しました。
sen.e: However, in Europe and other parts of the world, a transition from the Paleolithic period to the Neolithic period is set as the Mesolithic period.

sen.j: そして、ここに属するとされる場合もある。
sen.e: And it is sometimes considered to be a part of it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And it is sometimes considered to be a part of this.
And it is sometimes considered to be a part of this.

sen.j: ユーラシア大陸の中央部にあるアルタイ地方には約4万年前頃に幅1センチメートル以下の石刃（細石刃）がすでに発生していたという。
sen.e: It is said that the flint blades whose width was less than a centimeter (called saisekijin, or flint microblades) already came into existence in the Altai Region, which is in the central part of the Eurasian Continent, about 40000 years ago.

It is said that the flint blades whose width was less than a centimeter (called saisekijin, or flint microblades) already came into existence in the Altai Region, which is in the central part of the Eurasian Continent, about 40000 years ago.

It is said that the flint blades whose width was less than a centimeter (called saisekijin, or flint microblades) already came into existence in the Altai Region, which is in the central part of the Eurasian Continent, about 40000 years ago.

sen.j: これが東シベリア・極東地域の細石刃の起源であるとされている。
sen.e: This is considered to be the origin of saisekijin in East Siberia and the Far East.
This is considered to be the origin of saisekijin in East Siberia and the Far East.
This is considered to be the origin of saisekijin in East Siberia and the Far East.

sen.j: しかし、最近では、このような石器の変遷観は見直されようとしている。
sen.e: Lately, however, these views concerning the transition period of the stone tools are being reconsidered.
Lately, however, these views concerning the transition period of the stone tools are being reconsidered.
Lately, however, these views concerning the transition period of the stone tools are being reconsidered.

sen.j: 日本列島の旧石器時代の最終に現れたのが、この細石器（細石刃）を使った細石刃文化である。
sen.e: What appeared at the end of the Paleolithic era in Japan is the Saisekijin Culture in which saisekki (or saisekijin) was used.
What appeared at the end of the Paleolithic period in the Japanese archipelago is the Saisekijin Culture in which saisekki (or saisekijin) was used.
What appeared at the end of the Paleolithic period in the Japanese archipelago is the Saisekijin Culture in which saisekki (or saisekijin) was used.

sen.j: この文化がいつ頃から出現するのか、正確な年代はよく分かっていない。
sen.e: The exact date of its appearance is not well known.
The exact date of its appearance is not well known.
The exact date of its appearance is not well known.

sen.j: 本州でこの文化のもっとも古い年代は静岡県休場遺跡から知られる。
sen.e: The first appearance date in Honshu is identified by the Yasumiba-iseki Remains in Shizuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The first appearance date in Honshu is identified by the Yasumiba-iseki Remains in Shizuoka Prefecture.
The first appearance date in Honshu is identified by the Yasumiba-iseki Remains in Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 放射性炭素年代測定法によれば14,300年前である。
sen.e: Radioactive carbon dating shows that it dates back to 14300 years ago.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Radioactive carbon dating shows that it dates back to 14300 years ago.
Radioactive carbon dating shows that it dates back to 14300 years ago.

sen.j: そして、終末は12,000年前にむかえたようである。
sen.e: And it seems to have ended 12000 years ago.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And it seems to have ended 12000 years ago.
And it seems to have ended 12000 years ago.

sen.j: 北海道では約2万年前といわれている。
sen.e: It is said to have appeared in Hokkaido about 20000 years ago.
It is said to have appeared in Hokkaido Prefecture about 20000 years ago.
It is said to have appeared in Hokkaido Prefecture about 20000 years ago.

sen.j: この文化の存続期間は短かった。
sen.e: The culture lasted for a short period of time.
The culture lasted for a short period of time.
The culture lasted for a short period of time.

sen.j: 縄文時代の草創期まで存続した可能性が高い。
sen.e: It is likely that it continued until the beginning of the Jomon Period.
It is likely that it continued until the beginning of the Jomon period.
It is likely that it continued until the beginning of the Jomon period.

sen.j: この細石刃文化期（14,300～12,000年前）の遺跡は、全国で500個所を優に超える。
sen.e: The number of the remains dating back to the period of Saisekijin Culture (14300-12000 years ago) easily exceeds five hundred.
The number of the remains dating back to the period of Saisekijin Culture (from 14300 to 12000 years ago) easily exceeds 500.
The number of the remains dating back to the period of Saisekijin Culture (from 14300 to 12000 years ago) easily exceeds 500.

sen.j: 特に遺跡密度が高いのは北海道と九州で、近畿地方では遺跡数が極端に少ない。
sen.e: The density of the remains is especially high in Hokkaido and Kyushu, while their number is extremely low in the Kinki region.
The density of the remains is especially high in Hokkaido and Kyushu regions, while their number is extremely low in the Kinki region.
The density of the remains is especially high in Hokkaido and Kyushu regions, while their number is extremely low in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 石材は黒曜石、砂岩、チャート、流紋岩、安山岩、頁岩などである。
sen.e: The stones used include obsidian, sandstone, chert, rhyolite, andesite, shale, and so on.
The stones used include obsidian, sandstone, chert, rhyolite, andesite, shale, and so on.
The stones used include obsidian, sandstone, chert, rhyolite, andesite, shale, and so on.

sen.j: つまり、その地域で利用できる岩石が用いられた。
sen.e: Stated differently, the stones and rocks that were available in the local area were used.
Stated differently, the stones and rocks that were available in the local area were used.
Stated differently, the stones and rocks that were available in the local area were used.

sen.j: この文化は、細石刃核の形態や製作技術に地域的な変化が顕著である。
sen.e: In this culture, notable regional differences are found with respect to the shape of the saisekijin core and its fabrication method.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In this culture, notable regional differences are found with respect to the shape of the saisekijin core and its fabrication method.
In this culture, notable regional differences are found with respect to the shape of the saisekijin core and its fabrication method.

sen.j: そして、それが特徴である。
sen.e: And this is the characteristics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And this is the characteristics.
And this is the characteristics.

sen.j: 北海道の細石刃核は、湧別技法として知られる白滝型・札骨（さつこつ）型・峠下（とうげした）型・蘭越（らんこし）型、忍路子（おしょろこ）型、幌加（ほろか）型、射的山型、紅葉山型などに類別される。
sen.e: The cores of saisekijin in Hokkaido are classified into the Shirataki type, the Satsukotsu type, the Togeshita type, and the Rankoshi type, which are known to be made with the Yubetsu technique, as well as the Oshoroko type, the Horoka type, the Shatekiyama type, the Momijiyama type, and so on.

The cores of saisekijin in Hokkaido Prefecture are classified into the following types known as Yubetsu technique (technique in Yubetsu area): Types of Shirataki Remains, of the Satsukotsu Remains, of Togeshita Remains, of Rankoshi Remains, of Oshoroko Remains, of Horoka-gawa (or Horokazawa) Remains, of Shatekiyama Remains, of Momijiyama Remains, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「札骨」は「札滑」として訳出し表現を変えました。
sen.e: The cores of saisekijin in Hokkaido Prefecture are classified into the following types known as Yubetsu technique (technique in Yubetsu area): Types of Shirataki Remains, of the Satsukotsu Remains, of Togeshita Remains, of Rankoshi Remains, of Oshoroko Remains, of Horoka-gawa (or Horokazawa) Remains, of Shatekiyama Remains, of Momijiyama Remains, and so on.

sen.j: この湧別技法やその影響を受けた細石刃剥離技術は、津軽海峡を越えて山形県、新潟県、茨城県など東北地方の北半分まで拡がっている。
sen.e: The Yubetsu technique and the other saisekijin exfoliation techniques that were influenced by it fan out across the northern half of the Tohoku region, such as Yamagata Prefecture, Nigata Prefecture, and Ibaraki Prefecture, beyond the Tsugaru Straits.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: This Yubetsu technique and the other saisekijin exfoliation techniques that were influenced by it fan out across the northern half of the Tohoku region, such as Yamagata, Niigata, and Ibaraki Prefectures, beyond the Tsugaru Straits.

This Yubetsu technique and the other saisekijin exfoliation techniques that were influenced by it fan out across the northern half of the Tohoku region, such as Yamagata, Niigata, and Ibaraki Prefectures, beyond the Tsugaru Straits.

sen.j: そして、荒屋（あらや）型彫器を伴って検出される。
sen.e: They are found with Araya-type sculpted vessels.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: They are found with Araya-type sculpted vessels.
They are found with Araya-type sculpted vessels.

sen.j: 一方、西北九州を中心に、福井型と呼ばれる細石刃核が存在する。
sen.e: On the other hand, the core of saisekijin, which is called the Fukui type, is found mainly in northwest Kyushu.
On the other hand, the core of saisekijin, which is called the Fukui type (type in Fukui Prefecture), is found mainly in northwest Kyushu.
On the other hand, the core of saisekijin, which is called the Fukui type (type in Fukui Prefecture), is found mainly in northwest Kyushu.

sen.j: この石核には、縄文時代の草創期の土器である豆粒文（とうりゅうもん）土器、隆線文（りゅうせんもん）土器、爪形文（つめがたもん）土器などを伴う。
sen.e: This sekkaku (the stone core) is accompanied by the Toryumon earthenware, the Ryusenmon earthenware, the Tsumegatamon earthenware, and so on, which are from the Incipient Jomon Period.

This sekkaku (the stone core) is accompanied by the Toryumon (bean applique design) earthenware, the Ryusenmon (linear relief) earthenware, the Tsumegatamon (finger-nail like impressions) earthenware, and so on, which are from the Incipient Jomon period.

This sekkaku (the stone core) is accompanied by the Toryumon (bean applique design) earthenware, the Ryusenmon (linear relief) earthenware, the Tsumegatamon (finger-nail like impressions) earthenware, and so on, which are from the Incipient Jomon period.

sen.j: このほか南九州を中心に畦原（うねはら）型が知られる。
sen.e: Additionally, the Unehara type is known mainly in southern Kyushu.
Additionally, the Unehara type (type of Unehara Remains) is known mainly in southern Kyushu.
Additionally, the Unehara type (type of Unehara Remains) is known mainly in southern Kyushu.

sen.j: 野岳・休場型細石刃核は、関東・中部地方から九州までの広い地域に広がっている。
sen.e: The Nodake- and Yasumiba-type saisekijin cores spread to a wide area, namely from the Kanto and Chubu regions to Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The Nodake and Yasumiba type (type of Nodate Remains and Yasumiba Remains) saisekijin cores spread to a wide area, namely from regions of the Kanto and Chubu to Kyushu.
The Nodake and Yasumiba type (type of Nodate Remains and Yasumiba Remains) saisekijin cores spread to a wide area, namely from regions of the Kanto and Chubu to Kyushu.

sen.j: そして、円錐形、半円推形、角柱状などの形をしている。
sen.e: They are conical, half-conical, prismatic, etc. in shape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: They are conical, half-conical, prismatic, and so on, in shape.
They are conical, half-conical, prismatic, and so on, in shape.

sen.j: また、船野型細石刃核も宮崎平野、大野川流域から近畿南部、東海を経て中部南半分、南関東まで広く分布している。
sen.e: The Funano-type saisekijin core is also widely distributed from the Miyazaki-heiya Plains and the Ono-gawa River basin to the southern half of the Chubu region and south Kanto, via the southern part of the Kinki region and Tokai.

The Funano type (type of Funano Remains) saisekijin core is also widely distributed from the Miyazaki-heiya Plains and the Ono-gawa River basin to the southern half of the Chubu region and the south Kanto, via the southern part of the Kinki region and Tokai region.

The Funano type (type of Funano Remains) saisekijin core is also widely distributed from the Miyazaki-heiya Plains and the Ono-gawa River basin to the southern half of the Chubu region and the south Kanto, via the southern part of the Kinki region and Tokai region.

sen.j: 大きく分けると、日本列島の細石刃文化は、北東日本の楔形（くさびがた）細石刃と南西日本の野岳（のだけ）・休場（やすみば）型や船野型細石刃の二つの分布圏に分かれる。
sen.e: The Saisekijin Culture of the Japanese Islands is largely divided into two areas of distribution, that of cuneate saisekijin in northeast Japan and that of Nodake-, Yasumiba-, and Funano-type saisekijin in southwest Japan.

The Saisekijin Culture of the Japanese archipelago is largely divided into two areas of distribution, that of cuneate saisekijin in northeast Japan and those of Nodake, Yasumiba, and Funano types in the southwest Japan.

The Saisekijin Culture of the Japanese archipelago is largely divided into two areas of distribution, that of cuneate saisekijin in northeast Japan and those of Nodake, Yasumiba, and Funano types in the southwest Japan.

sen.j: 前者はシベリアから北海道を経由して本州へ、後者は中国黄河中・下流から九州を経由して本州へ及んだらしい。
sen.e: It appears that the former reached Honshu (the main island of Japan) through Siberia and then Hokkaido and the latter through the middle and lower Yellow River of China and then Kyushu.
It appears that the former reached Honshu (the main island of Japan) through Siberia and then Hokkaido and the latter through the middle and lower Yellow River of China and then Kyushu.
It appears that the former reached Honshu (the main island of Japan) through Siberia and then Hokkaido and the latter through the middle and lower Yellow River of China and then Kyushu.

sen.j: この文化段階で、北方から相当数本州へやってきた可能性が否定できない。
sen.e: The possibility that a considerable number came from the north to Honshu at this cultural stage cannot be denied.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The possibility that a considerable number came from the north to Honshu at this cultural stage cannot be denied.
The possibility that a considerable number came from the north to Honshu at this cultural stage cannot be denied.

sen.j: そのため、後期旧石器人がそのまま縄文人になったわけではないと想像できる。
sen.e: Thus, it is conjectured that late Paleolithic man did not directly become Jomon man.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Thus, it is conjectured that the late Paleolithic people did not directly become the Jomon people.
Thus, it is conjectured that the late Paleolithic people did not directly become the Jomon people.

sen.j: 長さはだいたい3センチ以下、幅0.5センチ前後で小形の石刃である。
sen.e: Saisekki is a small flint blade, whose length is less than roughly three centimeters and whose width is 0.5 centimeters or so.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Saisekki is a small flint blade, whose length is less than roughly three centimeters and whose width is 0.5 centimeters or so.
Saisekki is a small flint blade, whose length is less than roughly three centimeters and whose width is 0.5 centimeters or so.

sen.j: 幾つかを木や動物の骨の柄に溝を掘り、はめ込んで使用した。
sen.e: A few pieces were mounted in the carved-out areas of a hilt made of wood and animal bones.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: A few pieces were mounted in the carved-out areas of a hilt made of wood and animal bones.
A few pieces were mounted in the carved-out areas of a hilt made of wood and animal bones.

sen.j: 植刃器や尖頭器として用いられた一種の替え刃式の石器である。
sen.e: It is a kind of stone tools with replacement blades that were found in inserted-blade and pointed tools.
It is a kind of stone tools with replacement blades that were found in inserted-blade and pointed tools.
It is a kind of stone tools with replacement blades that were found in inserted-blade and pointed tools.

sen.j: 槍や銛の先端近くに刃として埋め込んで貫通性能を高めた。
sen.e: Embedding it as a blade near the point of a spear and a harpoon increased the piercing capacity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Embedding it as a blade near the point of a spear and a harpoon increased the piercing capacity.
Embedding it as a blade near the point of a spear and a harpoon increased the piercing capacity.

sen.j: 槍全体を軽量化することによって投げ槍としての命中率を高める効果も期待されたと推測される。
sen.e: It is presumed that reducing the weight of the whole spear was also expected to produce improvement in the accuracy rate of javelins.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is presumed that reducing the weight of the whole spear was also expected to produce improvement in the accuracy rate of javelins.
It is presumed that reducing the weight of the whole spear was also expected to produce improvement in the accuracy rate of javelins.

sen.j: 別名、細石刃（さいせきじん）。
sen.e: Another name is saisekijin.
It is also referred as saisekijin.
It is also referred as saisekijin.

sen.j: しかし、日本では、細石刃を装着した実例は知られていない。
sen.e: In Japan, however, there is no known example that used saisekijin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In Japan, however, there is no known example that used saisekijin.
In Japan, however, there is no known example that used saisekijin.

sen.j: だが、シベリヤや中国の出土例から類推されている。
sen.e: However, it is inferred by analogy from unearthed articles in Siberia and China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it is inferred by analogy from unearthed articles in Siberia and China.
However, it is inferred by analogy from unearthed articles in Siberia and China.

sen.j: 世界にさきがけて中国東北部からシベリアのバイカル湖付近で発達したと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered to have developed first somewhere between the northeastern part of China and the environs of the Baikal-ko Lake before the rest of the world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is considered to have developed first around the northeastern part of China and the Lake Baikal before the rest of the world.
It is considered to have developed first around the northeastern part of China and the Lake Baikal before the rest of the world.

sen.j: そして、アラスカに至るまで瞬く間に広がった。
sen.e: And it spread rapidly as far as Alaska.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And it spread rapidly as far as Alaska.
And it spread rapidly as far as Alaska.

sen.j: 世界各地の広い範囲から出土している。
sen.e: It is found widely in many parts of the world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is unearthed widely in many parts of the world.
It is unearthed widely in many parts of the world.
